name: indigestible
content:
indigestible adjective
(FOOD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
Indigestible food is difficult or impossible for the stomach to break down: a tough and indigestible piece of steak Beans have some indigestible carbohydrates that can give you wind.
More examplesFewer examplesBeet pulp is an indigestible fiber.The pigeon had body and texture, without being tough and indigestible.Octopuses are delicacies in some countries, but in others are regarded here as indigestible rubber.

indigestible adjective
(INFORMATION)
disapproving Indigestible information is difficult or impossible to understand: The statistics are virtually indigestible presented in this form. The book is a largely indigestible mass of explanations of the legislative process.
More examplesFewer examplesThe theorem is notoriously indigestible.His prose is often indigestible and pretentious. I don't want to litter my blog with indigestible academic stuff.

Related word
indigestibility
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of food) difficult or impossible to change into smaller forms that the body can absorb after eating it: The meat was so tough, it was almost indigestible.
